tit.e: The Period of the Crown Prince
The Period of the Crown Prince

sen.j: 生母が藤原の出でない為、関白藤原頼通や弟の藤原教通に疎んじられたが、彼等の異母弟の藤原能信の支援を受けたと言われている。
sen.e: As the Emperor's birth mother was not from FUJIWARA clan, he was treated coldly by chancello (chief advisor to the emperor), FUJIWARA no Yorimichi and his brother, FUJIWARA no Norimichi, however it is said their half yonger brother, FUJIWARA no Yorinobu supported Emperor Go-Sanjo.

Because the Emperor's birth mother was not from the FUJIWARA clan, he was treated coldly by the chancellor (chief advisor to the Emperor), FUJIWARA no Yorimichi and his brother, FUJIWARA no Norimichi; however, it is said their younger half-brother, FUJIWARA no Yorinobu, supported Emperor Go-Sanjo.

Because the Emperor's birth mother was not from the FUJIWARA clan, he was treated coldly by the chancellor (chief advisor to the Emperor), FUJIWARA no Yorimichi and his brother, FUJIWARA no Norimichi; however, it is said their younger half-brother, FUJIWARA no Yorinobu, supported Emperor Gosanjo.

sen.j: 『今鏡』によると、後朱雀天皇が尊仁親王を兄の親仁親王（後冷泉天皇）の皇太弟にと考えていたのを、頼通が抑えていたのに対し、能信が強く薦めて、その遺詔により皇太弟となる事が出来たとある。
sen.e: According to Ima Kagami, "The Mirror of the Present", Emperor Go-Suzaku considered Prince Takahito as his brother, Prince Chikahito's (Emperor Go-Reizei) Crown Prince, although Yorimichi was against it, Yoshinobu supported and Pince Takahito became Crown Prince due to Yoshinobu's will.

According to Ima Kagami's "The Mirror of the Present," Emperor Go-Suzaku considered Prince Takahito as his brother and Prince Chikahito (Emperor Go-Reizei) as the crown prince, so although Yorimichi was against it, at Yoshinobu's insistence Prince Takahito became the crown prince.

According to "Ima Kagami (The Mirror of the Present)," Emperor Gosuzaku considered Prince Takahito of his older brother, Prince Chikahito's (Emperor Goreizei) successor, as Crowin Princes' younger brother, although Yorimichi was against it, at Yoshinobu's insistence Prince Takahito became the crown prince.
sen.cmt: Ima Kagami's "The Mirror of the Present,"→"Ima Kagami (The Mirror of the Present)," Go-Suzaku→GosuzakuGo-Reizei→Goｒeizei原文の「後朱雀天皇が尊仁親王を兄の親仁親王（後冷泉天皇）の皇太弟にと考えていたのを」の部分ですが、「後朱雀天皇は、尊仁親王を兄である親仁親王（後冷泉天皇）の皇太弟（つまり兄が死んだら次に天皇になる立場）にしたいと考えていたのを」という意味が出るように訳しました。

sen.j: しかし、頼通や教通は、後冷泉天皇の後宮に娘を入内させて外祖父として権力を握る為に、尊仁親王に対して陽に陰に圧迫を加えていた。
sen.e: However Yorimichi and Norimichi kept on putting pressure on Prince Takahito directly or indirectly, to send their daughters to Emperor Go-Suzaku's Palace and take control of political power as maternal grandfather.

However Yorimichi and Norimichi kept on putting pressure on Prince Takahito directly or indirectly, to send their daughters to Emperor Go-Suzaku's Palace and take control of political power as maternal grandfather.

sen.j: その一例として、歴代の東宮が伝領する「壷切の剣」を頼通が「藤原氏（特に摂関家）腹の東宮の宝物」との理由で、23年もの間、親王が即位するまで献上しなかった事が、大江匡房の談話集『江談抄』に記されている。
sen.e: According to "Go Dan Sho" written by Oe no Masafusa, there is an example of above, Yorimichi did not give away Tsubo kiri no ken passed through successive Princes as for twenty three years until the enthronement of the Prince, the reason being 'The Tsubo kiri no ken was FUJIWARA clan (especially for the clan [family] eligible for regent's treasure'.

According to "Go Dan Sho," written by Oe no Masafusa, there is an example of the above: Yorimichi did not give away Tsubo kiri no ken (a traditional sword handed down from emperor to crown prince) which passed through successive princes for 23 years until the enthronement of the prince, the reason being that 'the Tsubo kiri no ken was meant for the FUJIWARA clan's (specially the Sekkan-ke (families of the Fujiwara clan whose members were eligible to become regent) treasure.'

sen.j: しかし、結局後冷泉天皇にはついに皇子がなく、天皇の死後、尊仁親王は即位した。
sen.e: But Emperor Go-Reizei did not have any children and after Emperor died, Prince Takahito enthroned.

However, Emperor Goreizei had no children, so after he died, Prince Takahito was enthroned.

sen.j: 頼通が失意のあまり引退した後、藤原彰子の推挙で弟の教通を関白にしたが、反摂関家の急先鋒で東宮時代の天皇を庇護していた故能信の養子の藤原能長や、村上源氏の源師房等を登用して摂関家の政権独占打破を図り、大江匡房や藤原実政等の下級役人などを登用し、積極的に親政を行った。
sen.e: After Yorimichi abdicated with the disappointment, his brother, Yorimichi became chancellor (chief advisor to the emperor) with the help of FUJIWARA no Shoshi, Fujiwara no Yoshinobu's adopted son, FUJIWARA no Yoshinaga and MINAMOTO no Morofusa from the Genji [MINAMOTO] family were appointed to the position to defeat the dominant politics of the clan [family] eligible for regents while FUJIWARA no Yoshinobu used to support the Emperor when he was Crown Prince and was an active leader of anti clan [family] eligible for regents.

sen.j: また、源隆国のように、東宮時代の天皇を頼通に気兼ねして蔑ろにしていた者に対しても、隆国の子息の源俊明を登用する等、決して報復的態度を取らないように公正な態度を示した。

tit.e: Good Government During the Enkyu Period
Good Government During the Enkyu Period

sen.j: 1069年荘園整理令を発布して記録荘園券契所を設置し、1070年には絹布の制、1072年には延久宣旨枡や估価估価法の制定等、律令制度の形骸化により弱体化した皇室の経済基盤の強化を図った。
sen.e: In 1069 the Decree Restricting the Expansion of Private Estates was issued and and an contract office to record the Estate was established, followed by issuing silk fabric regulation in 1070, then Enkyu measuring cup fixed by Emperor's order; the official measuring cup and the price regulation were established, the Emperor tried to build strong financial base of Imperial Court, which was destabilized due to the system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo codes become a mere facade.

sen.j: 特に延久の荘園整理令は、今までの整理令に見られなかった緻密さと公正さが見られ、その為に基準外の摂関家領が没収される等（『後二条師通記』に記載有り）、摂関家の経済基盤に大打撃を与えた。
sen.e: Especially Enkyu Decree Restricting the Expansion of Private Estates gave a big damage towards weakened financial bases of the clan [family] eligible for regents, since it had absolute fairness and details.

Especially Enkyu Decree Restricting the Expansion of Private Estates gave a big damage towards weakened financial bases of the clan [family] eligible for regents, since it had absolute fairness and details.

The Enkyu Decree Restricting the Expansion of Private Estates was much more detailed and much fairer than any previous such decrees; as a result, it was particularly harmful to the weakened finances of the Sekkan-ke (families of the Fujiwara clan whose members were eligible to become regent) as the private estates of the Sekkan-ke were confiscated, for example (details of these events were recorded in the "Gonijo Moromichiki," which was the diary of FUJIWARA no Moromichi, who later became Chancellor).
